entries.text: Dazzling lights, like flames, forced my eyes shut.
Words merely from ancient legends, flowed effortlessly from my lips.
I recounted this dream, over and over, until everyone deemed me mad.
Whenever I succumbed to the colorless life,
Scenes from the dream would flash before my eyes,
As if constantly reminding me of what the world should truly be.
Old stories say that the brightest fruits are often the most deadly.
And now, I am ready to embark on this deadly journey.
